questions.question: The committee decided to ____ the old regulations and introduce a more flexible policy.
options: abolish
cherish
furnish
publish
questions.correctAnswer: abolish

questions.question: The ____ between the two nations grew worse after the border dispute escalated.
options: remedy
friction
surplus
fabric
questions.correctAnswer: friction

questions.question: Although the evidence was largely ____, the jury found it convincing enough to reach a verdict.
options: territorial
municipal
circumstantial
residential
questions.correctAnswer: circumstantial

questions.question: Researchers have found that sleep deprivation can ____ impair cognitive function and decision-making.
options: marginally
severely
reluctantly
eloquently
questions.correctAnswer: severely

questions.question: The architect's design was praised for its ____ blend of modern aesthetics and traditional elements.
options: volatile
mediocre
harmonious
hazardous
questions.correctAnswer: harmonious

questions.question: The government imposed strict ____ on the import of certain agricultural products.
options: restrictions
dimensions
nominations
submissions
questions.correctAnswer: restrictions

questions.question: The professor's lecture was so ____ that even students who usually lost interest remained attentive throughout.
options: tedious
obscure
engaging
redundant
questions.correctAnswer: engaging

questions.question: The new medication proved to be highly ____ in treating the symptoms, with most patients reporting improvement within days.
options: deficient
adjacent
compatible
effective
questions.correctAnswer: effective

questions.question: The widespread adoption of electric vehicles has been hindered primarily by the lack of charging infrastructure.
options: Electric vehicles have become popular despite limited charging stations.
The main obstacle to the broad use of electric vehicles has been insufficient charging facilities.
Charging infrastructure has improved significantly since electric vehicles were introduced.
Most people prefer electric vehicles but cannot afford the cost of charging them.
questions.correctAnswer: The main obstacle to the broad use of electric vehicles has been insufficient charging facilities.

questions.question: Only after the scandal became public did the corporation acknowledge its responsibility for the environmental damage.
options: The corporation denied causing any environmental damage even after the scandal.
The corporation took responsibility for the damage before the scandal was exposed.
It was not until the scandal was revealed that the corporation admitted its role in the environmental harm.
The corporation caused the scandal by refusing to acknowledge the environmental damage.
questions.correctAnswer: It was not until the scandal was revealed that the corporation admitted its role in the environmental harm.

questions.question: Despite its remote location, the village attracts thousands of tourists annually due to its unique cultural heritage.
options: The village's isolation has prevented it from becoming a tourist destination.
Thousands of tourists visit the village every year, drawn by its distinctive culture, even though it is hard to reach.
The village has become accessible to tourists thanks to recent infrastructure development.
Cultural heritage sites are typically found in remote villages throughout the region.
questions.correctAnswer: Thousands of tourists visit the village every year, drawn by its distinctive culture, even though it is hard to reach.

questions.question: No sooner had the policy been implemented than its shortcomings became apparent to everyone involved.
options: The policy's flaws were evident immediately after it was put into effect.
Everyone involved agreed that the policy should be implemented despite its flaws.
The shortcomings of the policy were identified long before it was implemented.
The policy was implemented successfully, though minor adjustments were later needed.
questions.correctAnswer: The policy's flaws were evident immediately after it was put into effect.

questions.passage: Text I - The decline of handwriting
questions.question: According to the first paragraph, handwriting instruction in schools -
options: has always been considered less important than typing skills
has been reduced or eliminated in many educational systems
remains a core requirement in all Western countries
was recently reintroduced after being removed for decades
questions.correctAnswer: has been reduced or eliminated in many educational systems

questions.passage: Text I - The decline of handwriting
questions.question: The word 'proponents' in the second paragraph most likely refers to people who -
options: oppose the teaching of handwriting
study the history of writing systems
support maintaining handwriting education
develop new digital writing tools
questions.correctAnswer: support maintaining handwriting education

questions.passage: Text I - The decline of handwriting
questions.question: Research mentioned in the text suggests that handwriting -
options: is slower and therefore less efficient than typing
activates brain regions associated with learning and memory
should be taught only to students with learning difficulties
has no measurable cognitive benefits compared to typing
questions.correctAnswer: activates brain regions associated with learning and memory

questions.passage: Text I - The decline of handwriting
questions.question: According to the text, students who take notes by hand -
options: write down more information than those who type
tend to process information more deeply than those who type
perform worse on tests than students who use laptops
prefer this method because it is faster
questions.correctAnswer: tend to process information more deeply than those who type

questions.passage: Text I - The decline of handwriting
questions.question: The author's attitude toward the decline of handwriting can best be described as -
options: indifferent, seeing it as inevitable progress
concerned, suggesting that important benefits may be lost
enthusiastic, favoring digital alternatives
nostalgic, but ultimately supportive of the change
questions.correctAnswer: concerned, suggesting that important benefits may be lost

questions.passage: Text II - Urban vertical farming
questions.question: What is the main advantage of vertical farming mentioned in the first paragraph?
options: It requires less water than traditional farming
It allows food to be grown in densely populated areas year-round
It produces crops that taste better than conventionally grown ones
It eliminates the need for artificial lighting
questions.correctAnswer: It allows food to be grown in densely populated areas year-round

questions.passage: Text II - Urban vertical farming
questions.question: According to the text, one challenge facing vertical farming is -
options: the inability to grow root vegetables
resistance from traditional farmers
the high energy costs of artificial lighting
a shortage of qualified agricultural workers
questions.correctAnswer: the high energy costs of artificial lighting

questions.passage: Text II - Urban vertical farming
questions.question: The text states that vertical farms use significantly less water because -
options: the crops grown require very little irrigation
water is recycled within a closed-loop system
rainfall is collected on the building's roof
genetically modified plants need less water
questions.correctAnswer: water is recycled within a closed-loop system

questions.passage: Text II - Urban vertical farming
questions.question: The word 'scalability' in the third paragraph refers to -
options: the weight of the crops that can be produced
the ability to increase production to meet growing demand
the height of the buildings used for farming
the variety of crops that can be cultivated
questions.correctAnswer: the ability to increase production to meet growing demand

questions.passage: Text II - Urban vertical farming
questions.question: Based on the text, the future of vertical farming depends primarily on -
options: government subsidies for urban agriculture
consumer willingness to pay higher prices
advances in energy efficiency and cost reduction
the development of new crop varieties
questions.correctAnswer: advances in energy efficiency and cost reduction

questions.question: The journalist's ____ investigation uncovered a network of corruption that had gone unnoticed for years.
options: superficial
meticulous
ambiguous
sporadic
questions.correctAnswer: meticulous

questions.question: The company's decision to ____ its overseas factories resulted in thousands of lost jobs.
options: relocate
inaugurate
subsidize
renovate
questions.correctAnswer: relocate

questions.question: Many historians argue that the treaty was merely a ____ measure, delaying rather than preventing the inevitable conflict.
options: permanent
radical
temporary
conclusive
questions.correctAnswer: temporary

questions.question: The artist's work is ____ for its bold use of color and unconventional composition.
options: renowned
confined
destined
restrained
questions.correctAnswer: renowned

questions.question: The doctor warned that failure to ____ the prescribed treatment could lead to serious complications.
options: adhere to
dispose of
account for
object to
questions.correctAnswer: adhere to

questions.question: The volcanic eruption had ____ consequences for the surrounding ecosystem, destroying habitats that had taken centuries to develop.
options: negligible
devastating
provisional
supplementary
questions.correctAnswer: devastating

questions.question: The organization aims to ____ public awareness about the importance of mental health through educational campaigns.
options: diminish
elevate
withhold
distort
questions.correctAnswer: elevate

questions.question: The data presented in the report is ____ with the findings of previous studies on the same topic.
options: consistent
deficient
indifferent
resistant
questions.correctAnswer: consistent

questions.question: Had the rescue team arrived even a few minutes later, the outcome would have been tragically different.
options: The rescue team arrived too late to prevent the tragic outcome.
The timely arrival of the rescue team was crucial in averting a disaster.
The rescue team's delay of a few minutes did not affect the outcome.
If the rescue team had come earlier, the tragedy could still not have been prevented.
questions.correctAnswer: The timely arrival of the rescue team was crucial in averting a disaster.

questions.question: The archaeological discovery was deemed so significant that it fundamentally altered scholars' understanding of ancient trade routes.
options: Scholars had already known about the ancient trade routes before the discovery.
The archaeological find was important enough to reshape how academics viewed ancient commerce pathways.
Ancient trade routes were discovered thanks to a significant change in scholarly methods.
The discovery confirmed what scholars had long believed about ancient trade routes.
questions.correctAnswer: The archaeological find was important enough to reshape how academics viewed ancient commerce pathways.

questions.question: The new regulation applies to all businesses, irrespective of their size or annual revenue.
options: The regulation was designed specifically for large businesses with high revenue.
Small businesses are exempt from the regulation if their revenue is below a threshold.
Every business must comply with the regulation, regardless of how large or profitable it is.
The regulation's impact varies depending on the size of the business.
questions.correctAnswer: Every business must comply with the regulation, regardless of how large or profitable it is.

questions.question: Far from being a disadvantage, the candidate's lack of political experience was seen by many voters as a refreshing quality.
options: Voters were concerned about the candidate's inexperience in politics.
The candidate's political inexperience, rather than being a drawback, was viewed positively by many.
Many voters refused to support a candidate without political experience.
The candidate's experience in other fields compensated for the lack of political background.
questions.correctAnswer: The candidate's political inexperience, rather than being a drawback, was viewed positively by many.

questions.passage: Text III - The science of forgetting
questions.question: According to the first paragraph, forgetting is -
options: always a sign of cognitive decline
a normal and even useful brain function
more common in older adults than in children
caused primarily by stress and lack of sleep
questions.correctAnswer: a normal and even useful brain function

questions.passage: Text III - The science of forgetting
questions.question: The 'decay theory' mentioned in the text suggests that -
options: memories are deliberately erased by the brain
memory traces weaken over time if not reinforced
all memories eventually become false memories
forgetting occurs only during sleep
questions.correctAnswer: memory traces weaken over time if not reinforced

questions.passage: Text III - The science of forgetting
questions.question: Based on the text, interference theory explains forgetting as -
options: a result of new information competing with or replacing old memories
a consequence of emotional trauma blocking access to memories
a natural process of clearing unnecessary information during sleep
an effect of physical damage to specific brain regions
questions.correctAnswer: a result of new information competing with or replacing old memories

questions.passage: Text III - The science of forgetting
questions.question: The text implies that a person who remembers everything -
options: has a significant intellectual advantage
can process new information more efficiently
may actually suffer from this condition
is extremely rare but otherwise unaffected
questions.correctAnswer: may actually suffer from this condition

questions.passage: Text III - The science of forgetting
questions.question: An appropriate title for the text would be -
options: Memory Loss: A Growing Health Crisis
Why We Forget — And Why It Matters
New Treatments for Memory Disorders
The Difference Between Short-Term and Long-Term Memory
questions.correctAnswer: Why We Forget — And Why It Matters

questions.passage: Text IV - The economics of fast fashion
questions.question: According to the text, the fast fashion industry grew rapidly because -
options: consumers demanded higher quality clothing
retailers offered trendy clothing at very low prices
traditional fashion houses lowered their prices
online shopping made clothing more accessible
questions.correctAnswer: retailers offered trendy clothing at very low prices

questions.passage: Text IV - The economics of fast fashion
questions.question: The environmental impact of fast fashion includes all of the following EXCEPT -
options: massive textile waste in landfills
water pollution from dyeing processes
deforestation for cotton plantations
depletion of rare earth minerals
questions.correctAnswer: depletion of rare earth minerals

questions.passage: Text IV - The economics of fast fashion
questions.question: The 'slow fashion' movement mentioned in the third paragraph advocates for -
options: wearing only handmade clothing
buying fewer, higher-quality items that last longer
returning to traditional tailoring methods
boycotting all major clothing brands
questions.correctAnswer: buying fewer, higher-quality items that last longer

questions.passage: Text IV - The economics of fast fashion
questions.question: The word 'exploitative' in the text most likely describes practices that are -
options: innovative and forward-thinking
unfair, taking advantage of vulnerable workers
outdated and no longer in use
expensive but justified by quality
questions.correctAnswer: unfair, taking advantage of vulnerable workers

questions.passage: Text IV - The economics of fast fashion
questions.question: The author's main purpose in writing this text is to -
options: promote specific clothing brands that are environmentally friendly
explain the economic model of fast fashion and highlight its consequences
argue that fashion should be regulated by government agencies
compare the cost of fast fashion with that of luxury brands
questions.correctAnswer: explain the economic model of fast fashion and highlight its consequences
